Race.SpecificTitle: Member of School Board -- District G
PW HRC Amendment -- Art. II, Sec. 2-01(A) & Art. III, Sec. 3-02 - PC
Race.SummaryText: Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall Article II, Section 2-01, Subsection (A) and Article III, Section 3-02 of the Home Rule Charter of the Parish of Tangipahoa, State of Louisiana be amended to read: "The legislative power of the parish government shall be vested in a council consisting of ten (10) members elected for four (4) year terms from districts described in Section 8-10 (Election of Officials), one (1) from and by the qualified electors in each district. Beginning on January 1, 2016, no council member shall be allowed to serve more than three (3) consecutive four (4) year terms." (Article II, Section 2-01, Subsection (A)) and "The president shall be elected at large from and by the qualified electors of the parish according to the election laws of the state for a four (4) year term. Beginning on January 1, 2016, no president shall be allowed to serve more than three (3) consecutive four (4) year terms." (Article III, Section 3-02)?

Race.SpecificTitle: Rural Fire Protection Dist. No. 2 -- 10 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Rural Fire Protection District No. 2 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Rural Fire Protection District No. 2 of the Parish of Tangipahoa, Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to renew the levy and collection of a special tax of ten (10) mills on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $2,487,979.07 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) (the "Tax"), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2016 and ending with the year 2025, for the purpose of maintaining and operating the District's fire protection facilities, for maintaining, operating and purchasing fire trucks and other fire-fighting equipment and paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, and providing emergency services to the residents of the District?
